title: Man 'slashed lover then stamped on her head' but says it was 'rough sex'
text:

A man who allegedly slashed his girlfriend with a knife and stamped on her head in a "savage battering" told police she'd inflicted the injuries herself during "rough sex".

Cardiff Crown Court heard Kane Elliott was "frothing at the mouth" when police entered the flat and found Rhiannon Davies naked and bleeding heavily.

She had slash marks across her back and serious injuries to her swollen face including two black eyes.

Prosecutor Meirion Davies told the court that police had found 26-year-old Elliott "very aggressive" when they arrived at his flat in Cwmbran, Gwent, and he "began frothing at the mouth".

(Image: WALES NEWS SERVICE)

"He kept shouting 'who is she, get her out of my flat' and 'she's been in here beating herself up'," said Mr Davies.

"He was arrested and during his police interview denied assaulting Miss Davies.

"He told them she had assaulted herself as part of having rough sex."

The court heard neighbours raised the alarm after hearing banging coming from Elliot's flat and before seeing Miss Davies in the street.

One neighbour said he called police after allegedly hearing Elliott shout: "Come back or I'll get a butcher's knife and skin you alive."

(Image: Western Mail)

Mr Davies said: "When police arrived they found Miss Davies naked and showing signs of heavy bleeding and injuries to her face which was swollen. She had two black eyes.

"There were a number of slash marks on her back. There was bruising on her legs and arms. This was a savage battering."

Miss Davies told police Elliott asked her to cut herself with a knife but when she refused he cut her.

Mr Davies added: "She also references being slashed in the back. She described Elliott strangling her while she was on the floor.

"She was begging him to stop. She tried to escape but was dragged back.

"She tried to deceive him, telling him she was pregnant. But he punched her to the stomach anyway.

"At one point when she was being strangled she felt like her eyes would pop out."

(Image: Media Wales Ltd)

The court heard Miss Davies eventually escaped and ran outside to call for help.

Miss Davies told officers that her injuries had left her "looking like the Elephant Man".

Mr Davies said: "This woman was subject to an attack by Elliott which can only be described as savage. It was brutal."

The alleged attack left Miss Davies with serious injuries to her face and body - including slash marks on her back which needed several stitches.

Elliott, from Cwmbran, denies wounding with intent, unlawful wounding and making threats to kill.
description: Kane Elliot allegedly left girlfriend Rhiannon Davies looking 'like the Elephant Man' in what was described in court as a 'savage and brutal' attack in Cwmbran, Gwent
